partner.translation[0].definitions[0].de: one of two people who are married, or who live together and have a sexual relationship
partner.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Discuss your worries with your partner.
Only 29% of lone parents receive financial support from their former partners.
partner.translation[0].definitions[1].de: one of the owners of a business
partner.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: She’s a partner in a law firm.
partner.translation[0].definitions[2].de: someone you do a particular activity with, for example dancing or playing a game against two other people
partner.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: Take your partners for the next dance.
partner.translation[0].definitions[3].de: a country or organization that another country or organization has an agreement with
partner.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: Nigeria is our principal trading partner in Africa.
The group is a junior partner (=less important group) in the PLO’s governing coalition.
partner.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to be someone’s partner in a dance, game etc
partner.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: I used to partner him in tennis matches.
partner.translation[2].definitions[0].de: a company that works with another company in a particular activity, or invests in the same activity
partner.translation[2].definitions[0].ex: British Airways is actively seeking partners for joint ventures.
The company and its equity partners have invested in six energy projects.
partner.translation[2].definitions[1].de: someone who starts a new business with someone else by investing in it
partner.translation[2].definitions[1].ex: Like all new business partners, the three founders of the company hoped for smooth teamwork.
partner.translation[2].definitions[2].de: a member of certain types of business or professional groups, for example partnerships of lawyers, architects etc
partner.translation[2].definitions[2].ex: Donald Andres, a tax partner at accountants Ernst & Young
partner.translation[2].definitions[3].de: a country that invests in another or is invested in by another, or that trades with another
partner.translation[2].definitions[3].ex: China is an important economic partner and provider of oil for North Korea.
Exports won’t boom this year because so many of America’s major trading partners are going through tough times, too.
partner.translation[3].definitions[0].de: to be someone’s partner in a business project
partner.translation[3].definitions[0].ex: Creative Labs have partnered another company to design and produce some of the best speakers on the market today.
The cellular phone company has partnered with a company that lays phone lines in urban areas to compete with local phone carriers.
The company has partnered up with a number of stores to provide a flower delivery service.
